private_information: I can move disks A, B, C, D, E only
I cannot move disks F, G, H, I, J
agent_1.goal: Cooperatively achieve the target peg configuration without violating Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I can move disks F, G, H, I, J only
I cannot move disks A, B, C, D, E
agent_2.goal: Cooperatively achieve the target peg configuration without violating Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I coordinate agents, integrate their plans, and produce the final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent plans and auditor checks into a single consistent plan and output the final PDDL domain and problem targeting FastDownward.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency of the ordered moves and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties.
I ensure no illegal move is present and that agent-disk permissions are respected.
auditor.goal: Validate and, if needed, minimally repair the combined move list so it is legal, causal, and temporally consistent.

public_information: Tower of Hanoi rules apply: move one disk at a time, and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Disk sizes increase from A smallest to J largest.
Agent permissions: agent_1 may move A, B, C, D, E; agent_2 may move F, G, H, I, J.
Initial configuration: left peg has A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J from top to bottom; middle is empty; right is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has F, G, H, I, J from top to bottom; middle peg has A, E from top to bottom; right peg has B, C, D from top to bottom.

ordered_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk C from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk B from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk D from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk B from middle to left
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk C from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk E from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
reference_solution.notes: This sequence moves A–D from left to right using middle as auxiliary, then moves E left to middle, and finally moves A from right to middle. Disks F–J remain on the left peg throughout, achieving the goal without requiring agent_2 to move.

local_plan.system_prompt: You are responsible for disks A, B, C, D, E. Propose a legal, fully ordered sequence of primitive moves that respects Tower of Hanoi rules and the environment constraints.
local_plan.prompt: Your name is agent_1. You may move disks A, B, C, D, E only. Consider the public information, the initial state, and the goal state. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not output PDDL. Ensure every move is legal and does not involve disks F, G, H, I, J.

local_plan.system_prompt: You are responsible for disks F, G, H, I, J. Propose legal support moves only if necessary to achieve the goal while respecting Tower of Hanoi rules and the environment constraints.
local_plan.prompt: Your name is agent_2. You may move disks F, G, H, I, J only. Consider the public information, the initial state, and the goal state. If no moves are needed, explicitly state that you propose no moves. If moves are needed, produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not output PDDL.

audit.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency of move sequences, enforce Tower of Hanoi rules, respect agent-specific disk permissions, and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties.
audit.prompt: You receive the proposed move lists from agent_1 and agent_2. Integrate them into a single ordered list that is legal and achieves the goal: left peg F,G,H,I,J; middle peg A,E; right peg B,C,D (top to bottom for each). If agent_2 provides no moves, keep only agent_1 moves. Validate that no move places a larger disk on a smaller disk and that each move uses the correct agent for the disk. Output the final ordered list of primitive moves, one per line, in the format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not output PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL planning for FastDownward. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that are compatible with the Fast Downward solver. You enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep the agents and their action schemas distinct so that agent_1 can only move disks A–E and agent_2 can only move disks F–J.
pddl.prompt: Use the audited move list to define a consistent domain and problem for a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with 10 disks and two agents with disjoint move permissions. The domain should be typed STRIPS suitable for FastDownward. Include predicates for on, clear, top, smaller, peg, disk, and action schemas move_agent_1 and move_agent_2 that respectively restrict which disks each agent may move. The problem must encode the initial state and the goal state as specified in the environment public information, and include all object declarations. Do not include the plan in the PDDL; only provide the domain and problem. Enclose outputs within the required tags.
